intro: Kleberiella longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed kleberiella, is a unique species within the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its climbing habit and elongated, slender stems that can reach several meters in length. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Kleberiella longipes is native to tropical regions and is often found growing in moist, shaded environments.
